content: achieved by working the stripes thicker as the size increases for the pinstripe option stripes are 6 7 8 rounds and pinstripes are 2 rounds for the option without pinstripes work 8 9 10 rounds in each stripe color yarn selection tips this is a great scrap yarn project but you can also buy yarn in small quantities to make up some or all of the colors do not mix superwash yarns and non-superwash yarns but for this project it s okay to mix plied yarns with single-ply yarns check the yardage vs weight on the ball band or measure the wraps per inch to see if the yarns are similar in thickness some products are marked fingering or sock yarn but are much finer or much puffier than standard murrell s row p 4 non-superwash yarn will felt if treated roughly do not attempt to machine wash or dry non-superwash projects superwash yarn stretches out when soaked for blocking if using superwash then after pressing the water out and rolling the hat in a towel run the hat through a machine dryer on low heat for a few minutes until the hat is barely damp and has returned to its original shape recommended yarns that come in minis holly dyeworks mini skein sets kelbourne woolens perennial emma s yarn practically perfect sock smalls madeline tosh tosh merino light unicorn tails kim dyes yarn sourdough sock half skeins knit picks stroll mini packs color arrangement tips the patch and pinstripes need high contrast with the other yarns select semi-solids that are either very dark or very light the more uniform the color the better if the shade changes a lot within the yarn there will be areas where the pinstripes and the skull motif disappear when the shade comes too close to the shade of the other yarn put your yarns on a table and step back a few feet which ones pop the most which ones provide the most dramatic depth take a picture and desaturate it which grays look the same arrange your selected stripe yarns to look for an even color balance can you make one group of dark and one of light one of greens and yellows and one of blues and purples one of speckles and one of solid once you ve got two distinct groups alternate one yarn from each group to see how the stripes look in order is there too much visual weight grouped together in one part of the hat rearrange the stripes until they look balanced stripe customization tips to adapt the stripe depth and number of stripes calculate a new stripe arrangement that adds up to the desired total hat height count the hatband as 4 rounds try to avoid reducing the total hat height by more than a couple of
